intro: Reseda baetica, commonly known as the Spanish dyer's weed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Reseda baetica is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments. It has been historically used for its dye-producing properties, particularly in traditional textile industries.
